content:
Sure, here is a beginner's yoga routine that incorporates some of the beginner poses we mentioned earlier:

1. Mountain Pose (Tadasana) - 30 seconds to 1 minute
2. Downward-Facing Dog (Adho Mukha Svanasana) - 30 seconds to 1 minute
3. Warrior I (Virabhadrasana I) - 30 seconds to 1 minute
4. Warrior II (Virabhadrasana II) - 30 seconds to 1 minute
5. Triangle Pose (Trikonasana) - 30 seconds to 1 minute
6. Child’s Pose (Balasana) - 30 seconds to 1 minute
7. Bridge Pose (Setu Bandhasana) - 30 seconds to 1 minute
8. Corpse Pose (Savasana) - 5 to 10 minutes

You can repeat this sequence 2-3 times depending on how much time you have. Remember to focus on your breath and listen to your body. If a pose feels uncomfortable, come out of it slowly and safely, and modify it if necessary.

You may also want to warm up before starting your practice with some gentle stretches, such as neck rolls, shoulder rolls, and spinal twists.

Hope this helps you in your yoga journey! Enjoy your practice.
